question: What is the general formula for calculating the required flowrate of fertilizer in kg/min?
expected_answer: Working width (m) x Driving speed (km/h) x Application rate (kg/ha) / 600

The formula given is flowrate required (kg/min) = Working width (m) x Driving speed (km/h) x Application rate (kg/ha) / 600. That makes sense because the units need to be consistent, so multiplying meters by kilometers per hour gives km·m/(h), which when divided by 600 converts it into kg/min.
